comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Profile of her husband includes a lot about her career: embryo.asu.edu/view/embryo:124439

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/11418107@N02] An excerpt from The Embryo Project Encyclopedia on Warren Harmon Lewis, husband of Margaret Reed Lewis: "On 23 May 1910 he married Margaret Reed of Pennsylvania, whom he met while working at the Marine Biological Laboratory at Woods Hole and who would join him in his future research endeavors, including early amphibian embryology and mammalian tissue culture. She was a graduate of Goucher College and held a number of research positions, including working in Max Hartmann’s lab in Berlin with Rhoda Erdmann in 1908 on tissue cultures and as an assistant to Thomas Hunt Morgan at Bryn Mawr College and Columbia University. She also taught physiology and biology at New York Medical College, Barnard College, and Miss Chapin’s School." Thanks, Penny! Susannah Smithsonian Institution Archives
